reviews.text:
A very bright star on the Croatian Michelin sky!

Highlights include:
- Creative presentation and stellar taste (particularly the gold dessert)
- Upscale atmosphere
- Very attentive and polite staff

Improvement suggestion:
- Would be helpful to point out somewhere that the six-course menu is only available for larger parties.

Overall, a great place for fine dining in Zagreb! We will be back for sure!

Dissapointing experience. The black ink rissoto was nice but the veel was accompanied by a very strong and thick I guess mushroom puree (there is an unhealthy obsession in the Zagreb fine dining scene with purees) with touches of pomelo? that was just unpleasant and incongruous with the meat. The fish was combined with a sweet puree (similar problem in Zinfandel, did the chefs study in the same school?) which just doesn't work well with fish. The desert was ok but not on the level it should be I guess if they want to catch that elusive michelin star. Service was great. Price not too high.

EDIT: Wow, they just got the michelin star for 2024. What a load of crock. Michelin is really eroding it's credibility as a fine dining guide.

My wife and I had an excellent experience having dinner here.  The food, atmosphere, and service is superb!  We tried the chef's course, and were very satisfied trying all the different courses that were planned.  The dishes are prepared in a very modern style, and the presentation on the dishes was quite enticing.  I would recommend to anyone looking for a fancy night out!

I wonder why the restaurant is not awarded a Michelin star.  It really deserves it.  A simple and well composed menu, excellent service, good wine list, excellent atmosphere and setting, top quality food.
Perfect service, perfect food, fair price, friendly staff
